{{Distinguish|Mount Furi}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox video game | title = Furi | image = Furi video game_logo.png | developer = [[The Game Bakers]] | publisher = The Game Bakers | engine = [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[PlayStation 4]]|[[Xbox One]]|[[Nintendo Switch]]}} | released = {{Unbulleted list|'''Microsoft Windows''', '''PlayStation 4'''|5 July 2016|'''Xbox One'''|2 December 2016|'''Nintendo Switch'''|11 January 2018}} | genre = [[Action game|Action]], [[shoot 'em up]], [[hack and slash]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] | director = Emeric Thoa | producer = Emeric Thoa | designer = {{Plainlist| *Benjamin Le Moullec *Valentin Livi *Steven Slater }} | programmer = Nam Hoang | artist = {{Plainlist| *Anthony Beyer *[[Takashi Okazaki]] }} | writer = {{Plainlist| *Audrey Leprince *Mélanie Decroix }} | composer = {{Plainlist| *[[Carpenter Brut]] *[[Danger (musician)|Danger]] *[[The Toxic Avenger (musician)|The Toxic Avenger]] *[[Lorn (musician)|Lorn]] *[[Waveshaper (musician)|Waveshaper]] }} }} '''''Furi''''' is an [[Action game|action]] [[shoot 'em up]] video game developed and published by indie studio [[The Game Bakers]] available for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], and [[Nintendo Switch]]. The game takes place on a planet in a colorful, retro, science fiction setting. ==Gameplay== ''Furi'' is a fast-paced [[action game]] with [[hack and slash]], twin-stick [[shoot 'em up]], and "bullet hell" elements, consisting entirely of [[boss fight]]s. Gameplay consists mostly of dodging bullets, parrying attacks, attacking the bosses by melee or shooting, and [[quick time event]]s. The game is set in closed world environments. Much of the game's story progresses through these interactions, along with animated [[cutscene]]s occurring before and after a boss fight. ==Plot== A mysterious man spends his existence receiving endless torture within a highly advanced prison, composed of ten islands floating in orbit above a planet's surface. At the beginning of the game, an enigmatic man wearing a rabbit disguise who is known as The Voice frees the Stranger, gives him a sword and gun, and encourages him to fight for his freedom. The Stranger must navigate each area, wherein dwells a single powerful guardian who exists only to prevent him from escaping: The Chain, a sadistic staff-wielding jailor who tortured the Stranger; The Strap, a prisoner armed with a laser cannon on her head driven mad from her imprisonment; The Line, a wise old man who wields a sword longer than his body and can manipulate time; The Scale, a vengeful diver armed with twin harpoons; The Hand, a noble knight who was responsible for imprisoning the Stranger in the first place; The Song, an angelic woman armed with twin crossbows who conceived the prison; The Burst, a sniper and master tactician; The Edge, an oar-wielding warrior who dedicated his life to fighting The Stranger; and The Beat, a young woman who strives to guard the final door. As the journey goes on, more about the reasons for imprisoning the Stranger surface, and the Voice reveals that he was the architect who created the prison to protect the planet from the Stranger, but he could not stand being locked in it, and freed the Stranger to be able to escape with him so that he could see his daughter again. Upon reaching the planet's surface, the Stranger finds that his mere presence destroys all physical structures on the planet, including living things. Later exploring the planet more, the Stranger ventures into a structure which holds an attachable device he uses to fly off the planet and into space to meet The Star, the mothership who created him, and many other clones like him. She calls him Rider. The game contains two normal endings and a secret ending. When facing The Star, Rider can decide to either assimilate the planet or refuse to obey the mothership, thus prompting the tenth and final boss fight against The Star. By assimilating the planet, Rider allows The Star to send out an army of other warriors like him to invade the planet. By refusing to obey the mothership and canceling the invasion, Rider battles and destroys The Star, preventing the planet from being invaded. The secret ending can occur by accepting The Song's offer to stay in her sanctuary-like section of the prison, where she will provide for The Rider. She claims that this will make her the hero of all her people. The "One More Fight" DLC provides an additional boss, a cyborg called The Flame who challenges the Stranger in an arena beneath the structure holding the Stranger's flying rig. Like The Scale, he seeks vengeance on the Stranger for what happened to his world. If the player defeats The Flame and all other bosses on the highest difficulty setting, they will unlock the hardest fight in the game: a basically modeled figure known as Bernard who fights using an amalgamation of the other bosses' attacks. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | MC = (PC) 76/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/furi |title=Furi for PC Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=4 July 2016}}
(PS4) 77/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/furi |title=Furi for PlayStation 4 Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=4 July 2016}} | Destruct = 7.5/10{{cite web |last=Devore |first=Jordan |date=5 July 2016 |url=https://www.destructoid.com/review-furi-373298.phtml |title=Review: Furi |publisher=[[Destructoid]] |accessdate=5 July 2016}} | EGM = 8/10{{cite web |last=Carsillo |first=Ray |date=6 July 2016 |url=http://www.egmnow.com/articles/reviews/furi-review/ |title=Furi review |publisher=[[Electronic Gaming Monthly]] |accessdate=6 July 2016}} | GI = 6/10{{cite web |last=Marchiafava |first=Jeff |date=14 July 2016 |url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/furi/b/playstation4/archive/2016/07/14/a-stylish-fight-with-frustration.aspx |title=Furi - A Stylish Fight With Frustration - PlayStation 4 |publisher=[[Game Informer]] |accessdate=14 July 2016}} | GameRev = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web |last=Blondeau |first=Elias |date=5 July 2016 |url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/furi |title=Furi Review |publisher=[[Game Revolution]] |accessdate=5 July 2016}} | GSpot = 8/10{{cite web |last=Brown |first=Peter |date=9 July 2016 |url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/furi-review/1900-6416472/ |title=Furi Review |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |accessdate=9 July 2016}} | IGN = 6.8/10{{cite web |last=Rad |first=Chloi |date=13 July 2016 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2016/07/13/furi-review |title=Furi Review |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=13 July 2016}} | PCGUS = 86/100{{cite web |last=Davenport |first=James |date=6 July 2016 |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/furi-review/ |title=Furi review |publisher=[[PC Gamer]] |accessdate=6 July 2016}} | VG = 7/10{{cite web |last=Orry |first=Tom |date=4 July 2016 |url=https://www.videogamer.com/reviews/furi-review |title=Furi Review |publisher=VideoGamer.com|accessdate=4 July 2016}} }} ''Furi'' received "generally favorable" reviews, getting a critic score of 76 based off 12 critics on PC, and a 77 based off 37 critics on [[PlayStation 4]] according to [[review aggregator]] [[Metacritic]]. James Davenport of [[PC Gamer]] gave it an 86 out of 100, claiming it "is only held back by rare bugs and poorly designed difficulty spikes." Jeff Marchiafava of [[Game Informer]] gave it a 6 out of 10, citing a lack of engagement in the environment and unforgiving difficulty. {{clear}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.furigame.com/}} {{portalbar|Video games}} [[Category:2016 video games]] [[Category:Artificial intelligence in fiction]] [[Category:Fiction with unreliable narrators]] [[Category:Fighting games]] [[Category:Hack and slash games]] [[Category:Indie video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] [[Category:Powered exoskeletons in video games]] [[Category:Shoot 'em ups]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Unity (game engine) games]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]] [[Category:Video games with alternate endings]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox One games]]

{{for|films with similar titles|Gas (disambiguation)}} {{More citations needed|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox film | name = Gas-s-s-s | image = Gas-s-s-s.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Roger Corman]] | producer = Roger Corman | writer = [[George Armitage]] | narrator = | starring = [[Robert Corff]]
[[Elaine Giftos]]
[[George Armitage]]
[[Alex Wilson (actor)|Alex Wilson]] | music = [[Country Joe & the Fish]]
[[Barry Melton]] | cinematography = [[Ron Dexter]] | editing = [[George Van Noy]] |studio = San Jacinto Productions | distributor = [[American International Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|1970|9}} | runtime = 79 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = }} '''''Gas-s-s-s''''' (also known as '''''Gas! or It Became Necessary to Destroy the World in Order to Save It''''') is a 1970 [[motion picture]] produced and released by [[American International Pictures]]. It was [[movie producer|producer]] [[Roger Corman]]'s final film for AIP, after a long association. He was unhappy because AIP made several cuts to the film without his approval, including removing the final shot where God commented on the action — a shot Corman regarded as one of the greatest he had made in his life.Roger Corman & Jim Jerome, ''How I Made a Hundred Movies in Hollywood and Never lost a Dime'', Muller, 1990 p 166 The movie is a [[post-apocalyptic]] [[dark comedy]], about survivors of an accidental military [[gas leak]], of an experimental agent that kills everyone on Earth over the age of 25. (A cartoon [[title sequence]] shows a [[John Wayne]]-esque [[Army General]] announcing — and denouncing — the "accident"; the story picks up after the victims have died.) The lead characters, Coel and Cilla, were played by [[Robert Corff]] and [[Elaine Giftos]], and the cast features [[Ben Vereen]], [[Cindy Williams]], [[Bud Cort]] and [[Talia Shire]] (credited as "Tally Coppola") in early roles. [[Country Joe McDonald]] makes an appearance, as spokesman "AM Radio". ==Plot== In [[Dallas]], at the [[Southern Methodist University]], news comes in about a gas which has escaped from a military facility. It starts killing everyone over 25. Hippie Coel meets and falls in love with Cilla. They discover a [[Gestapo]]-like police force will be running Dallas and flee into the country. Their car is stolen by some cowboys. They then meet music fan Marissa, her boyfriend Carlos, Hooper and his girlfriend Coralee. Marissa leaves Carlos, who finds a new girlfriend. The group meet [[Edgar Allan Poe]] who drives around on a motorbike with a girl on the back. They then have an encounter with some bikers who play golf, after which they attend a dance and concert where AM Radio is performing and passing on messages from God. Coel sleeps with Zoe, but Cilla is not jealous. Coel, Cilla and their friends arrive at a peaceful commune where it seems mankind can start fresh. Then a football team attacks them. Eventually [[God]] intervenes. Coel and Cilla are reunited with all their friends and there is a big party where everyone gets along. ==Cast== * [[Robert Corff]] as Coel * [[Elaine Giftos]] as Cilla * [[Bud Cort]] as Hooper * [[Talia Shire]] as Coralee * [[Ben Vereen]] as Carlos * [[Cindy Williams]] as Marissa * [[Alex Wilson (actor)|Alex Wilson]] as Jason * [[George Armitage]] as Billy the Kid * [[Country Joe McDonald]] as AM Radio * [[Pat Patterson (actor)|Pat Patterson]] as Demeter * [[Gary Caplan]] as Raincoat Harry ==Production== George Armitage had met Roger Corman at 20th Century Fox when the latter was making ''[[The St. Valentine's Day Massacre (film)|The St Valentine's Day Massacre]]''. Armitage later recalled he wrote a script — "it was called either ''Carrot Butts'' or ''A Christmas Carrot'' — which had animated cartoon characters, [[Bugs Bunny]] and so on, coming to life. It was about the studio systems and all this stuff." His agent gave the script to [[Gene Corman|Gene [Corman, Roger's brother]]], who gave it to Roger, "and he loved it, so they submitted it to UA ([[United Artists]]) where they had a deal—[[Mike Medavoy]] was just taking over there and he was younger than I was. From there, Roger said: "Well, that didn't work, why don't we try something else?" Usually he has a title or something and he'll say: "Go ahead, write something, just keep the title."" ''Gas-s-s-s'' was an idea of Corman's, about a world where everybody over thirty had died. Corman later said "my first thought was to do a science fiction film with allegorical overtones."{{cite magazine|title=Ma Barker to von Richthofen: an interview with Roger Corman|last=Strick|first= Philip|magazine=Sight and Sound|edition=39.4|date= Fall 1970|page= 182}} Armitage remembers the concept just being "a sentence, and that's what we went with ... He let you make it your own, and I did." Corman said that although "there was some good work in" Armitage's first draft, "the points I was trying to make in the script either did not come through or came through too obviously different parts, and it became less science fiction and more and more a direct liberal left wing statement picture. I didn't want to be quite that obvious about what I was doing. So I then decided to switch to a comedy, thinking back to ''[[A Bucket of Blood|Bucket of Blood]]'' and ''[[The Little Shop of Horrors|Little Shop of Horrors]]''." [[United Artists]] had financed the script but Corman says they felt it was too risky to finance, as they believed it needed a budget of two million dollars. Corman bought the script back off them and decided to finance the film himself, at around $300,000. Corman says filming commenced using a first draft, which was rewritten constantly throughout the shoot. ===Shooting=== Armitage recalls, "We went back in '69 to shoot in New Mexico and Texas. I was the associate producer as well, and we were writing it as we went—which is something that Roger liked to do.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmcomment.com/blog/interview-george-armitage/|title=George Armitage|website=Film Comment}} "Winter was coming and I wanted to do the film," said Corman. "I was going to be shooting in New Mexico. I actually shot in December and to wait one more month would have put me in January and I could not have made the film. To wait till next summer would have dated the material I was dealing with, so I wanted to bring the film out early." "It was a very inexpensive film," said Corman. "It was shot with a skeleton crew, with a cast of almost entirely amateur actors. Only the leads were professionals."Goldman, C. (1971). An interview with ROGER CORMAN. Film Comment, 7(3), 49-54. Retrieved from https://search.proquest.com/docview/210229038 Shooting took around four weeks. Corman sold the movie to [[American International Pictures]] for the negative cost. The film features a tribute to [[Edgar Allan Poe]]. Corman says "It was actually a second thought when we put Poe in it. We just started putting things in. In the original concept, he wasn't in it. And we just decided to put him in on a motorcycle—it seemed appropriate."{{cite book|last=Nasr|first= Constantine|title= Roger Corman: Interviews (Conversations with Filmmakers Series)|page=77|publisher=University Press of Mississippi}} "There was some sense of disorganization and experimentation as we went along," says Corman. Corman says the film showed
that I was beginning to get a little disillusioned" with the youth culture of the time. "I intended that the picture be sympathetic toward our lead gang of kids yet, at the same time, I wanted to show that I was beginning to suspect that all of the ideas being spouted by the counter-culture and all of the dreams were not totally rooted in reality. In the picture, I wanted to literally give youth the world they desired and, then, make a cautionary statement about how youth might not be able to handle it as perfectly as they anticipated.{{cite book|last=Nasr|first= Constantine|title= Roger Corman: Interviews (Conversations with Filmmakers Series)|page=132|publisher=University Press of Mississippi}}
Corman said there were themes in the film "which go back through all my previous pictures, such as the theme of the destruction of the world which I've played with to a certain extent, and there are some certain political and religious overtones I've dealt with before but I've never put them all together like this. The film became something I firmly believe in." He added in 1971 that the film was
an attempt to look at certain aspects of the youth movement and an attempt to move to a better way of life. I end there with something 1 probably believe, which is that there is a struggle and that it is possible to overcome but not necessarily probable. It's not like some of the youth films that have come out in the last couple of years that have been an unquestioning acceptance of all the values of the youth culture. I've just been around too long to accept anything unquestioningly. This would be a kind of questioning acceptance of many of the values but not all of this culture. For that reason I'm not certain ''gasss'' will be a success ... Also the film is a little flawed in some areas.
==Editing disagreements== Roger Corman was angry about what AIP did to the film. He later wrote: {{quote|I ended the film with a spectacular shot from on top of the mesa, with a view sixty, seventy miles to the horizon ... God, who was a running character throughout the film, made his final comments on what went on ... There must have been three hundred people on top of that mesa. It was one of the greatest shots I ever achieved in my life. And AIP cut out the entire shot. They ended the picture on the couple's cliched kiss - because they didn't like what God was saying. The picture ended and made no sense ... Final cut approval had never been put in writing at AIP. It was more a tacit agreement ... AIP had grown into the biggest independent in the U.S. It was now a publicly held company. The more irreverent the film, the greater the financial risk ... [[James H. Nicholson|Jim [Nicholson]]] had grown conservative and it was his objections to my work that led to the cuts. Jim had done this on four films in a row. [Gas-s-s-s was] the one that really did it for me.}} Corman elaborated, saying he had God
played by an actor with an outrageous New York Jewish accent and they were really startled by that. But cutting God really took the heart out of the picture. I think it was partially the fact that AIP had become a public company and Sam was Jewish and they didn't want to be accused of being anti-Semitic.{{cite book|last=Nasr|first= Constantine|title= Roger Corman: Interviews (Conversations with Filmmakers Series)|pages=198–199|publisher= University Press of Mississippi.}}
Samuel Z. Arkoff of AIP recalled it differently: {{quote|When Roger left for Europe to shoot ''[[Von Richthofen and Brown]]'' for [[United Artists]], he turned over the rough cut to us. Jim [Nicholson] and I viewed it, and realized it needed substantial work. We so informed Roger, who didn't disagree ... Roger's handpicked editors eliminated lines, entire scenes, and even one of the leading characters in the film. They also cut out a final shot that Roger adored, in which he positioned the leading man, his lady, and three hundred extras on a mesa ... The camera panned back while the words of God were heard in a voice-over. For some reason, the voice of God had an accent. Roger thought it was one of the most spectacular shots of his film career. The editors thought it belonged on the cutting room floor, which was right where they left it ... We had tried, but the editors just couldn't save the picture.Samuel Z Arkoff, ''Flying Through Hollywood by the Seat of My Pants''}} ==Reception== Corman says the film opened and the [[Edinburgh Film Festival]] and he "got a cable from the organizers of the festival saying, "''gasss'' explodes. Five minutes standing ovation." I thought, "Boy, I've really got one." The film premiered in New York as part of a retrospective on Roger Corman's work.Film Retrospective to Honor Kazan By A. H. WEILER. New York Times (1923-Current file) [New York, N.Y] 27 Jan 1971: 32. In 1971 Corman stated:
AIP hates the picture. They dislike it intensely and they would not give it a New York opening. Since it's a very inexpensive picture, they've been playing it around the country in drive-ins and small towns where it's been doing only moderate business. The projection is that it will break even and possibly make a tiny profit. They don't want to spend the money to open in New York because it's very expensive to open right in New York. They feel it will not do well here and will turn a possibly slight loser into a slight failure. Because of the retrospective we have an essentially free opening here. However, I'm not quite as optimistic about the picture as I was after the news of the Edinburgh Festival. The fact that its been playing around to only moderate audiences may indicate some weaknesses in the film. On the other hand, it could mean that it's been playing to the wrong audiences.
According to [[Samuel Z. Arkoff]], "when ''Gas-s-s-s'' was released, it was promoted with ads that proclaimed, 'Invite a few friends over to watch the end of the world.' The picture didn't make any money." Corman later reflected:
One of the great problems is that the film is far too intellectual. Other people have told me that they think it's a meaningless film. They may well be both right. It is the most intricate and the most organized intellectual film that I have ever made. I was so careful to keep each concept deep behind a humorous look at it. I didn't want at any time to allow the preachings of what I was saying to come across too heavily and disturb the flow of the picture and its humor. In my desire to keep it in the background, I may have kept it so far in the background that I'm the only person who is going to know what is in every scene.
It was the last film Corman directed for AIP, and he only made one more movie before a twenty-year sabbatical. "
A great deal of care went into what I was saying and how I was going to say it," he said of ''Gas-s-s-s''. "The finished picture does not evidently make all these points. It discourages me and so for a little while I prefer to step away ... Directing is very hard and very painful. Producing is easy. I can do it without really thinking about it.
Corman did, however, go on to produce ''[[Boxcar Bertha]]'' for AIP. ''Gas-s-s-s'' found a fresh airing on [[late night television]] in the 1980s. In 2005 it was issued on [[DVD]], as a [[double feature]] with ''[[Wild in the Streets]]'', another AIP movie. ==See also== * [[List of American films of 1970]] * [[List of apocalyptic and post-apocalyptic fiction]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title|0065760}} *{{Amg movie|19277|Gas-s-s-s}} *[https://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9F02E1D71131E73BBC4F51DFB566838A669EDE Review of film] at [[New York Times]] *[http://www.grindhousedatabase.com/index.php/Gas-s-s-s ''Gas-s-s-s''] at Grindhouse Database *[http://www.avclub.com/article/emgas-s-s-s-em-57958 Review of film] at [[The A.V. Club]] *[https://variety.com/1969/film/reviews/gas-s-s-s-1200422226/ Review of film] at ''Variety'' {{Roger Corman}} [[Category:1970 films]] [[Category:1970s black comedy films]] [[Category:1970s comedy films]] [[Category:1970s road movies]] [[Category:1970s science fiction films]] [[Category:American black comedy films]] [[Category:American comedy science fiction films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American International Pictures films]] [[Category:American road movies]] [[Category:American satirical films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films directed by Roger Corman]] [[Category:Films produced by Roger Corman]] [[Category:Films set in Texas]] [[Category:Films shot in New Mexico]] [[Category:Films shot in Texas]] [[Category:God in fiction]] [[Category:Post-apocalyptic films]]

{{Orphan|date=November 2013}} '''Giorgi Maisuradze''' (born 1970 in [[Tbilisi]]), studied History, Philosophy, and the History of Culture in [[Tbilisi]], [[Saarbrücken]] and Berlin Universities. He has worked at Berlin Literary and Culture Research Centre since 2008. Maisuradze received his Ph.D. in Philosophy at [[Berlin Humboldt University]] in 2009. He has been Assistant Professor at [[Ilia Chavchavadze Tbilisi State University]] since 2010.
==List of publications== *2013 – ''[[Orthodox Ethics and the Spirit of Unfreedom]]'', Bakur Sulakauri Publishing House, Tbilisi. *2013 – ''[[Genese und Genealogie. Zur Bedeutung und Funktion des Ursprungs in der Ordnung der Genealogie]]'', Kulturverlag Kadmos, Berlin. (thesis, Berlin, Humboldt-Univ.<ref name=wct>[http://www.worldcat.org/title/genese-und-genealogie-zur-bedeutung-und-funktion-des-ursprungs-in-der-ordnung-der-genealogie/oclc/859372078&referer=brief_results WorldCat]</ref> *2013 – Kill Tbilisi, Bakur Sulakauri Publishing House, Tbilisi. *2012 – Lost Contexts *2011 – Closed Society and its Watchmen *2011 – Apocalyptic Beast *1998 – ''[[Sexes and Civilization]]''
==Literary Prizes== 2012 – Saba Literary Prize for the Best Essays and Documentary Prose of the Year (The Closed Society and its Watchmen).
==Apocalyptic Beast== (Annotation) The whole series of [[minimalist]] novels written over the course of 6 years (between 1993–1998) based on the experiment started by the author while studying in Germany, which later continued in Georgia. The cycle of parody texts began with the first novel the 9th Symphony. The prototypes were the author’s friends, Georgians living with him in a small cottage in one of the German villages. While searching for new forms to express his ideas, the author had started an unintentional linguistic experiment – personal feelings and concrete stories connected with friends were developed by mixing them with the author’s favorite literary characters and plots. Notably, these were times when the author practically did not have any information on postmodernist literature.
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Maisuradze, George}} [[Category:Cultural academics]] [[Category:Novelists from Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Tbilisi]] [[Category:1970 births]]

revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}}
'''Historical classification''' groups the various [[history]] topics into different categories according to subject matter as shown below.
==Meta-history== *[[Philosophy of history]]
==By geographic region== *[[History of the world|World]] *[[History of Africa|Africa]] *[[History of the Americas|Americas]] *[[History of Asia|Asia]] *[[History of Europe|Europe]] *[[History of Oceania|Oceania]] *[[History of Antarctica|Antarctica]]
==By geographic subregion== *[[History of North America|North America]] *[[History of South America|South America]] *[[History of Latin America|Latin America]] *[[History of Central America|Central America]] **[[Pre-Columbian]] **[[Mesoamerica]] *[[History of the Caribbean|Caribbean]] *[[History of Eurasia|Eurasia]] *[[History of Europe]] **[[Prehistoric Europe]] **[[Classical antiquity]] **[[Late Antiquity]] **[[Middle Ages]] **[[Early modern period]] **[[History of Europe#Modern Europe|Modern Europe]] *[[History of Central Asia|Central Asia]] *[[History of South Asia|South Asia]] *[[History of East Asia|East Asia]] *[[History of Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]] *[[History of the Middle East|Middle East]] **[[Ancient Near East]] *[[History of Australasia|Australasia]] ([[Australia]], [[New Guinea]], [[Micronesia]], [[Melanesia]], [[Polynesia]]) *[[History of the Pacific Islands|Pacific Islands]]
==By date== *[[Centuries]] *[[Decades]] *[[Periodization]] *[[List of time periods|List of named time periods]] *[[List of timelines]]
==By time period== *[[Prehistory]] *[[Ancient history]] *[[Modern world]]
See also [[Periodization]].
==By religion== *[[History of religion]] *[[History of Christianity]] *[[History of Islam]] *[[Jewish history]] *[[History of Buddhism]] *[[Hinduism]] History of Hinduism
==By nation== *[[Extinct countries, empires, etc.|History of extinct nations and states]]
==By field== *[[Cultural movement]]s *[[Diaspora studies]] *[[Family history]] *[[Environmental history]] *[[Local history]] *[[Maritime history]] *[[Microhistory]] *[[Confederation]] *[[Social History]] *[[Urban History]]
===Mathematics and the hard sciences=== *[[History of mathematics]] *[[History of science and technology]] *[[History of astronomy]] *[[History of physics]] *[[History of chemistry]] *[[History of geology]] *[[History of biology]] *[[History of medicine]] *[[History of mental illness]]
===Social sciences=== *[[History of art]] *[[History of astrology]] *[[History of cinema]] *[[History of economic thought]]/[[Economic history]] *[[History of ideas]] *[[History of literature]] *[[History of music]] *[[History of philosophy]] *[[History of sexuality]] *[[History of theatre]] *[[Intellectual history]] *[[Legal history]] *[[Microhistory]] *[[Military history]]
==By ideological classification (historiography)== Although there is arguably some intrinsic [[bias]] in history studies (with [[nationalism|national]] bias perhaps being the most significant), history can also be studied from [[ideology|ideological]] perspectives, which practitioners feel are often ignored, such as: *[[Marxist historiography]] *[[Feminist history]] (also called ''herstory'').
A form of historical speculation known commonly as [[counterfactual history]] has also been adopted by some historians as a means of assessing and exploring the possible outcomes if certain events had not occurred or had occurred in a different way. This is somewhat similar to the [[Alternate history (fiction)|alternate history]] genre in fiction.
Lists of false or dubious historical resources and [[historical myths]] that were once popular and widespread, or have become so, have also been prepared.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Historical Classification}} [[Category:History|classifications]]

{{GeoGroupTemplate}} [[File:1586 Rome obelisk erection.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Re-erection of the Vatican Obelisk by the [[Renaissance architect]] [[Domenico Fontana]] in 1586]] The city of [[Rome]] harbours the most [[obelisk]]s in the world. There are eight [[ancient Egypt]]ian and five [[Ancient Rome|ancient Roman]] '''obelisks in Rome''', together with a number of more modern obelisks; there was also until 2005 an [[Kingdom of Aksum|ancient Ethiopian]] obelisk in Rome. The Romans used special heavy cargo carriers called [[obelisk ships]] to transport the monuments down the [[Nile]] to [[Alexandria]] and from there across the [[Mediterranean Sea]] to Rome. On site, large [[Crane (machine)#History|Roman cranes]] were employed to erect the [[monolith]]s. == Ancient Egyptian obelisks == At least eight obelisks created in antiquity by the Egyptians were taken from Egypt after the [[Roman conquest of Egypt|Roman conquest]] and brought to Rome. {| class="wikitable" ! Image ! Height
(with base) ! Name ! Builder ! Location ! Notes |- | [[File:Obelisk-Lateran.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}32.18 m
(45.70 m) | ''[[Lateran Obelisk|Lateranense]]'' | [[Tuthmosis III]] / [[Tuthmosis IV]] | [[Piazza di San Giovanni in Laterano]]

{{coord|41|53|12.6|N|12|30|17.2|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Lateranense}} | Tallest obelisk in Rome, and the largest standing ancient Egyptian obelisk in the world, originally weighing around 455 [[ton]]s.https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/egypt/raising/rome.html From the temple of [[Amun]] in [[Karnak]],{{ref|map 1|map}} and brought to [[Alexandria]] with [[Obelisk of Theodosius|another obelisk]] by [[Constantius II]], and brought on its own from there to Rome in 357 to decorate the ''[[spina (Roman circus)|spina]]'' of the [[Circus Maximus]].{{ref|map 2|map}} Found in three pieces in 1587, restored approximately 4 m shorter by [[Pope Sixtus V]], and erected near the [[Lateran Palace]] and basilica of [[Basilica of St. John Lateran|San Giovanni in Laterano]] in 1588 in the place of the [[Equestrian Statue of Marcus Aurelius|equestrian statue]] of [[Marcus Aurelius]], which was moved to the [[Capitoline Hill]]. Current version weighs around 330 tons.http://www.ancient-wisdom.com/menhirs.htm |- | [[File:Vatican Piazza San Pietro Obelisk slim.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}25.5 m
(41 m)Supported on bronze lions and surmounted by the [[House of Chigi|Chigi]] arms in bronze, in all 41 m to the cross on its top | ''Vaticano'' | Unknown | [[Saint Peter's Square]]

{{coord|41|54|8.1|N|12|27|26.1|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Vaticano}} || [[File:Basilica di San Pietro 1450.jpg|thumb|100px|The [[old Basilica of Saint Peter]] with the obelisk at the left in its original place.]] Originally raised in the Forum Iulium in Alexandria{{ref|map 4|map}} by the prefect [[Cornelius Gallus]] on Augustus's orders around 30–28 BC. No hieroglyphs. Brought to Rome by [[Caligula]] in 40 for the ''spina'' of the [[Vatican Circus]].{{ref|map 5|map}} Relocated by [[Pope Sixtus V]] in 1586 using a method devised by [[Domenico Fontana]]; the first monumental obelisk raised in the modern period, it is the only obelisk in Rome that has not toppled since Roman times. During the Middle Ages, the gilt ball on top of the obelisk was believed to contain the ashes of [[Julius Caesar]].Touring Club Italiano, ''Roma e Dintorni''.''[http://depts.washington.edu/silkroad/texts/tafur.html#ch3 Travels and Adventures]'', Chapter 3, [[Pero Tafur]], digitized from [[The Broadway Travellers]] series, edited by Sir [[E. Denison Ross]] and [[Eileen Power]], translated and edited with an introduction by [[Malcolm Letts]] (New York, London: Harper & brothers 1926): {{quote|On the other side of it is a high tower made of one piece of stone, like a three-cornered diamond raised upon three brazen feet; and many, taking it for a holy thing, creep between the ground and the base of that tower. This was a work undertaken in honour of [[Julius Caesar]] and assigned for his burial, and on the top of it are three large gilt apples in which is the dust of the Emperor {{sic}} Julius Caesar, and certainly it is a noble edifice and marvellously ordered and very strange. It is called Caesar's needle, and in the middle and at the base, and even at the top, are a few ancient letters carved in the stone which now cannot well be read, but in fact they record that the body of Julius Caesar was buried there.}} Fontana later removed the ancient metal ball, now in a Rome museum, that stood atop the obelisk and found only dust. [[Pedro Tafur]] in his ''Andanças''[[Pedro Tafur]]'s ''[[Andanças]]'' (1874 edition) referenced in the ''[[Diccionario crítico etimológico castellano e hispánico]]'', [[Joan Corominas]], [[José Antonio Pascual]], 1987, Editorial Gredos, Tome I, {{ISBN|84-249-1361-2}}, entry ''carnicol'', page 880. (circa 1440) mentions that many passed between the ground and the "tower" base "thinking it a saintly thing". |- | [[File:Obelisk-popolo.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}24 m
(36.50 m) | ''[[Flaminio Obelisk|Flaminio]]'' | [[Seti I]] / [[Ramses II]] | [[Piazza del Popolo]]

{{coord|41|54|38.6|N|12|28|34.8|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Flaminio}} | Originally from [[Heliopolis (Ancient Egypt)|Heliopolis]].{{ref|map 7|map}} Brought to Rome by [[Augustus]] in 10 BC with the ''[[Solare (obelisk)|Solare]]'' obelisk and erected on the ''spina'' of the [[Circus Maximus]].{{ref|map 8|map}} Found with the ''Lateranense'' obelisk in 1587 in two pieces and erected by [[Pope Sixtus V]] in 1589. Sculptures with lion fountains were added to the base in 1818. Weighs around 235 tons. |- | [[File:SolareObelisk cropped.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}21.79 m
(33.97 m) | ''[[Solare (obelisk)|Solare]]'' | [[Psammetichus II]] | [[Piazza di Montecitorio]]

{{coord|41|54|2.5|N|12|28|43.2|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Solare}} | Originally from [[Heliopolis (Ancient Egypt)|Heliopolis]].{{ref|map 10|map}} Brought to Rome by [[Augustus]] in 10 BC with the ''Flaminio'' obelisk to form the [[gnomon]] of the ''[[Solarium Augusti]]'' in the ''[[Campus Martius]]''.{{ref|map 11|map}} Found in the 16th century but reburied. Rediscovered and erected by [[Pope Pius VI]] in front of the [[Palazzo Montecitorio]] in 1792. |- | [[File:obelisk in piazza della rotonda rome arp.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(2}}6.34 m
(14.52 m) | ''Macuteo'' | [[Ramses II]] | [[Piazza della Rotonda]]

{{coord|41|53|57.6|N|12|28|36.3|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Macuteo}} | Originally one of a pair at the Temple of [[Ra]] in [[Heliopolis (Ancient Egypt)|Heliopolis]], the other being the now much shorter ''Matteiano''. Moved to the Temple of [[Isis]] near [[Santa Maria sopra Minerva]]. Found in 1373 near [[Church of San Macuto|San Macuto]] and erected in Piazza Macuta. Moved to the front of the [[Pantheon, Rome|Pantheon]] by [[Pope Clement XI]] in 1711 over a fountain by [[Filippo Barigioni]]. |- | [[File:Roma Elephant Obelisk 2007-05-19 13-51-58 BW.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(2}}5.47 m
(12.69 m) | ''[[Elephant and Obelisk|Minerveo]]'' | [[Apries]] | [[Santa Maria sopra Minerva]]

{{coord|41|53|52.7|N|12|28|39.2|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Minerveo}} | Originally one of a pair from [[Sais]]. Brought to Rome by [[Diocletian]] for the nearby Temple of [[Isis]]. Found in 1655 and erected in 1667 by [[Pope Alexander VII]] on an [[Elephant and Obelisk|Elephant]] base by [[Bernini]], behind the [[Pantheon, Rome|Pantheon]] in [[Piazza della Minerva]]. The other of the pair is in [[Urbino]]. This is the smallest obelisk in Rome, with a heigh of 5.47 metersL'Italia. Roma (guida rossa), Touring Club Italiano, Milano 2004. |- | [[File:Dogali-obelisk.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(2}}?
(6.34 m) | ''Dogali'' | [[Ramses II]] | [[Baths of Diocletian]]

{{coord|41|54|7.8|N|12|29|50.9|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Dogali}} | Originally one of a pair from [[Heliopolis (Ancient Egypt)|Heliopolis]], the other now in the [[Boboli Gardens]] in [[Florence]]. Moved to the Temple of Isis in Rome. Found in 1883 by [[Rodolfo Lanciani]] near [[Santa Maria sopra Minerva]]. Now commemorates the [[Battle of Dogali]], originally in front of Near [[Termini Station (Rome)|Termini Station]] and moved to its present site in 1924. |- | [[File:Villa Celimontana Obelisk.JPG|125px|center]] | {{0|(2}}2.68 m
(12.23 m) | ''Matteiano'' | [[Ramses II]] | [[Villa Celimontana]]

{{coord|41|53|0.2|N|12|29|43.2|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Matteiano}} | Originally one of a pair at the Temple of [[Ra]] in [[Heliopolis (Ancient Egypt)|Heliopolis]], the other being the ''Macuteo'' which retains much more of its original height. Moved to the Temple of Isis near [[Santa Maria sopra Minerva]]. Found in the 14th century and erected east of [[Santa Maria in Aracoeli]] on the [[Capitoline]]. Moved to Villa Celimontana after [[Michelangelo]] redesigned the square in the late 16th century. Lost again; fragments rediscovered and re-erected in 1820. Smallest obelisk in Rome. *[http://highskyblue.web.fc2.com/celimontana.htm Further details] |- |} == Ancient Roman obelisks == {{GeoGroupTemplate|section=Ancient_Roman_obelisks}} At least five obelisks were manufactured in [[Roman Egypt|Egypt in the Roman period]] at the request of the wealthy Romans, or made in Rome as copies of ancient Egyptian originals. {| class="wikitable" ! Image ! Height
(with base) ! Name ! Location ! Notes |- | [[File:Vierstroemebrunnen Piazza Navona Rom.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}16.53 m
(30+ m) | ''Agonalis'' ''(Pamphilius)'' | [[Piazza Navona]]

{{coord|41|53|56.3|N|12|28|23.1|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Agonalis}} | A copy commissioned by [[Domitian]] and erected at the Temple of [[Serapis]]. Moved to the [[Circus of Maxentius]] by [[Maxentius]]. The Earl of Arundel paid a deposit and attempted to ship the four pieces to London in the late 1630s but Urban VIII disallowed its export.[[Edward Chaney]], "Roma Britannica and the Cultural Memory of Egypt: Lord Arundel and the Obelisk of Domitian", in ''Roma Britannica: Art Patronage and Cultural Exchange in Eighteenth-Century Rome'', eds. D. Marshall, K. Wolfe and S. Russell, British School at Rome, 2011, pp. 147-70. Erected on top of the [[Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi]] by [[Bernini]] in 1651. |- | [[File:RomaObeliscoQuirinale.JPG|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}14.63 m
(28.94 m) | ''Quirinale'' | [[Piazza del Quirinale]]

{{coord|41|53|56.7|N|12|29|11.9|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Quirinale}} | Originally erected on the eastern flank of the [[Mausoleum of Augustus]], paired with the ''Esquiline'' obelisk. Found in 1527. Erected by [[Pope Pius VI]] in 1786 on the [[Quirinal Hill]] next to statues of the [[Dioscuri]] (called the '[[Horse Tamers]]') from the [[Baths of Constantine (Rome)|Baths of Constantine]]. |- | [[File:Maggiore-obelisk.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}14.75 m
(25.53 m) | ''Esquiline'' | [[Piazza dell'Esquilino]]

{{coord|41|53|53.4|N|12|29|51|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Esquiline}} | Originally erected on the western flank of the [[Mausoleum of Augustus]], paired with the ''Quirinale'' obelisk. Found in 1527 and erected in 1587 by [[Pope Sixtus V]] behind [[Santa Maria Maggiore]]. |- | [[File:RomaObeliscoSallustiano.JPG|125px|center]] | {{0|(}}13.91 m
(30.45 m) | ''Sallustiano'' | [[Trinità dei Monti]]

{{coord|41|54|22.1|N|12|28|59.6|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Sallustiano}} | Above the [[Spanish Steps]]. An [[Aurelian]] copy, although smaller, of the ''Flaminio'' obelisk of Ramses II in the [[Piazza del Popolo]], for the [[Gardens of Sallust]]. Found by the [[Ludovisi (family)|Ludovisi]] and moved to the [[Piazza di San Giovanni in Laterano]] in 1734, but kept horizontal. Erected in 1789 by [[Pope Pius VI]]. |- | [[File:Hadrianic Obelisco del Pincio, Rome, Italy.jpg|125px|center]] | {{0|(1}}9.24 m
(17.26 m) | ''Pinciano'' | [[Pincian Hill]]

{{coord|41|54|38.9|N|12|28|47.1|E|dim:100_region:IT-RM_type:landmark|display=inline|name=Pinciano}} | Commissioned by [[Hadrian]] and erected in Tivoli for the tomb of [[Antinous]]. Moved to Rome by [[Elagabalus]] to decorate the ''spina'' of the [[Circus Varianus]]. Found in the 16th century near the [[Porta Maggiore]]. Moved to the [[Palazzo Barberini]], then moved to the [[Vatican City|Vatican]] by [[Pope Clement XIV]]; finally erected on the Pincian by [[Pope Pius VII]] in 1822. |- |} == Obelisk of Axum == [[File:2 giugno 2002-Axum.JPG|right|thumb|The [[Obelisk of Axum]] in Rome in 2002]] There was also an Ethiopian obelisk in Rome, the [[Obelisk of Axum]], 24 m, placed in the Piazza di [[Porta Capena]]. It had been taken from [[Axum]] by the [[Italian Army]] during the [[Second Italo–Abyssinian War|Italian occupation of Ethiopia]] in 1937. It was struck by [[lightning]] in May 2002. After being restored, it was cut into three pieces and returned to [[Ethiopia]] in April 2005. == Modern obelisks == [[File:Roma - EUR - Obelisco EUR.jpg|right|thumb|The Marconi obelisk, in the centre of the [[EUR district]]]] There are five well-known modern obelisks in Rome: * [[Villa Medici]], 19th century copy of the original, found in the gardens and taken to [[Florence]]. * Two obelisks in the [[Villa Torlonia (Rome)|Villa Torlonia]], 1842, [[Baveno]] [[granite]] * [[Foro Italico]], 1932, 17.5 m, [[Carrara marble]], originally dedicated to [[Benito Mussolini]], and inscribed ''Mussolini Dux'' * Marconi, 1959, 45 m, in the centre of the [[EUR district]], dedicated to [[Guglielmo Marconi]], built for the [[1960 Summer Olympics]]. 92 panels in white marble contain illustrations of Marconi's career and allegorical scenes. == Former locations of some obelisks == {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} * {{note|map 1}} ''Lateranense'' at Karnak, Egypt: {{coord|25|43|7.46|N|32|39|26.64|E|region:EG_type:landmark|name=Lateranense_Karnak}} * {{note|map 2}} ''Lateranense'' at Circus Maximus in Rome: {{Coord|41|53|6.31|N|12|29|14.45|E|type:landmark_region:IT|name=Lateranense_Circus_Maximus}} * {{note|map 4}} ''Vaticano'' at Forum Iulium in Alexandria, Egypt: {{Coord|31|11|52.8|N|29|55|9.12|E|type:city|name=Vaticano_Alexandria}} * {{note|map 5}} ''Vaticano'' at Vatican Circus in Rome: {{coord|41|54|5.82|N|12|27|14.94|E|type:landmark_region:IT|name=Vaticano_Circus_of_Nero}} * {{note|map 7}} ''Flaminio'' at Heliopolis, Egypt: {{coord|30|07|46.3|N|31|17|20|E|type:landmark|name=Flaminio_Heliopolis}} * {{note|map 8}} ''Flaminio'' at Circus Maximus in Rome: {{Coord|41|53|12.73|N|12|29|3.4|E|type:landmark_region:IT|name=Flaminio_Circus_Maximus}} * {{note|map 10}} ''Solare'' at Heliopolis, Egypt: {{coord|30|07|46.3|N|31|17|20|E|type:landmark|name=Solare_Heliopolis}} * {{note|map 11}} ''Solare'' at Campus Martius in Rome: {{Coord|41.902842|N|12.477733|E|type:landmark_region:IT|name=Solare_Campus_Martius}} {{col-end}} == Further reading == *{{Citation | last = Wirsching | first = Armin | title = How the Obelisks Reached Rome: Evidence of Roman Double-Ships | journal = [[The International Journal of Nautical Archaeology]] | volume = 29 | issue = 2 | pages = 273–283 | year = 2000 | doi=10.1111/j.1095-9270.2000.tb01456.x }} *{{Citation | last = Wirsching | first = Armin | title = Supplementary Remarks on the Roman Obelisk-Ships | journal = The International Journal of Nautical Archaeology | volume = 32 | issue = 1 | pages = 121–123 | year = 2003 | doi=10.1111/j.1095-9270.2003.tb01438.x }} *{{Citation | last = Wirsching | first = Armin | title = Obelisken transportieren und aufrichten in Aegypten und in Rom, {{ISBN|978-3-8334-8513-8}} | year = 2013|edition=3d }} *{{Citation | last = D'Onofrio | first = Cesare | title = Gli obelischi di Roma | year = 1967 }} == See also revision.text:
{{Redirect|Marielle|other people with this name|Marielle (given name)}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Marielle Franco |image = File:Marielle Franco.jpg |alt = 200px |order = [[Municipal Chamber of Rio de Janeiro|Councillor of Rio de Janeiro]] |president = |term_start = 1 January 2017 |term_end = 14 March 2018 |predecessor = |successor = |birth_name = Marielle Francisco da Silva |birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1979|7|27}} |birth_place = [[Rio de Janeiro]], [[Rio de Janeiro (state)|Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil |death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2018|3|14|1979|7|27}} |death_place = [[Rio de Janeiro]], [[Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil |death_cause = [[Assassination]] ([[Gunshot wound|Gunshot]]) |party = [[Socialism and Liberty Party|PSOL]] {{small|(2007-2018)}} |partner = Mônica Benício
{{small|(2006–2018; Franco's death)}} |children = 1 |alma_mater = [[Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro]]
[[Fluminense Federal University]] |occupation = Politician, sociologist }} '''Marielle Franco''' ({{IPA-pt|maɾiˈɛli ˈfɾɐ̃ku}}, born '''Marielle Francisco da Silva'''; 27 July 1979 – 14 March 2018) was a [[Brazil]]ian politician, feminist, and [[human rights]] activist.{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/marielle-franco-protested-police-violence-assassination|title=Brazilian Activist Marielle Franco, Who Protested Police Violence, Has Been Assassinated|date=15 March 2018|publisher=Vogue|author=Michelle Ruize|accessdate=2018-03-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408095951/https://www.vogue.com/article/marielle-franco-protested-police-violence-assassination|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no}} After earning a master's degree in public administration from the [[Fluminense Federal University]], she served as a city councillor of the [[Municipal Chamber of Rio de Janeiro]] for the [[Socialism and Liberty Party]] (PSOL) from January 2017 until her death. On 14 March 2018, while in a car after delivering a speech, Franco and her driver were shot multiple times and killed by two murderers in another vehicle, North in Rio de Janeiro. Franco had been an outspoken critic of [[police brutality]] and [[extrajudicial killing]]s,{{Cite web|url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/03/brazil-authorities-must-investigate-the-killing-of-human-rights-defender-marielle-franco/|title=Brazil: Authorities must investigate the killing of human rights defender Marielle Franco|last=|first=|date=15 March 2018|website=Amnesty International|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408095951/https://www.vogue.com/article/marielle-franco-protested-police-violence-assassination|archive-date=8 April 2018|dead-url=no|quote=known for denouncing police abuses and extrajudicial executions|access-date=17 March 2018}} as well as the February 2018 federal intervention by Brazilian president [[Michel Temer]] in the state of [[Rio de Janeiro (state)|Rio de Janeiro]] which resulted in the deployment of the army in police operations.{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2018/03/02/brazils-federal-intervention-in-rios-drug-wars-has-an-authoritarian-feel-and-could-backfire/|title=Brazil’s federal intervention in Rio’s drug wars has an authoritarian feel — and could backfire|last=Lessing|first=Benjamin|date=2 March 2018|website=The Washington Post|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408104534/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2018/03/02/brazils-federal-intervention-in-rios-drug-wars-has-an-authoritarian-feel-and-could-backfire/?utm_term=.019f7c56cd66|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Brazilian President Michel Temer, at a Feb. 16 late-night meeting with his Cabinet and top congressional leaders, decided the federal government would take over Rio’s police and prison system.|access-date=18 March 2018}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-43414527|title=Outrage over murder of Rio councillor|date=2018-03-15|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-03-15|language=en-GB|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408122838/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-43414527|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=She and her driver, Anderson Pedro Gomes, were both killed, and her press officer, who was sitting in the back seat of the car, was injured. … She was shot four times in the head, and three bullets hit Mr Gomes. … Ms Franco, who grew up in Mare, a favela complex in the north of the city, has been an outspoken critic of the move to deploy the army and the federal police force.}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/la-fg-brazil-marielle-franco-20180315-story.html|title=Outspoken Rio councilwoman who fought for the marginalized is shot to death; thousands mourn|last=Langlois|first=Jill|date=2018-03-15|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-03-16|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408124350/http://www.latimes.com/world/la-fg-brazil-marielle-franco-20180315-story.html|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Police said two men fired nine shots into Franco's car and sped off. Franco's driver, Anderson Pedro Gomes, was also killed. A press officer sitting next to Franco in the back seat was injured. … Her party also pointed to her vocal disapproval of a particular military police unit, which she called the "battalion of death." … "Marielle had just denounced the military police's brutal and truculent operation in the Iraja region of the Acari community," the Socialism and Liberty Party said in a statement. "We demand an immediate and rigorous investigation of this heinous crime. We will not keep quiet!"}} ==Early life== Franco was raised in [[Maré, Rio de Janeiro|Maré]], a [[favela|slum in northern Rio de Janeiro]], where she also resided for most of her life, and started to work to contribute to the [[Household income|household income]] in 1990 when she was 11 years old.{{Cite news|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20180315-brazil-critic-police-violence-mariella-franco-shot-dead-rio-de-janeiro|title=Anger in Brazil after prominent police critic is shot dead - France 24|date=2018-03-15|work=France 24|access-date=2018-03-15|language=en-USarchive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408130940/http://www.france24.com/en/20180315-brazil-critic-police-violence-mariella-franco-shot-dead-rio-de-janeiro|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Franco, who was raised and lived in the Mare complex of slums, long one of Rio's more dangerous areas, received over 46,500 votes in the 2016 election. That total was only bested by four of 51 council members.}} Marielle gave birth to her first and only child when she was 19 years old (in 1998).{{Cite web |url=https://www1.folha.uol.com.br/cotidiano/2018/03/feminista-negra-e-cria-da-mare-quem-foi-a-vereadora-marielle-franco.shtml |title=Da Maré, vereadora fazia parte do 'bonde de intelectuais da favela' |publisher=Folha de S.Paulo |author=Marco Aurélio Canônico |date=15 March 2018 |accessdate=16 March 2018|language=pt|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408140920/https://www1.folha.uol.com.br/cotidiano/2018/03/feminista-negra-e-cria-da-mare-quem-foi-a-vereadora-marielle-franco.shtml|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Marielle Francisco da Silva nasceu em 27 de julho de 1979, no Complexo da Maré, zona norte do Rio. … Começou a trabalhar aos 11 anos, para pagar sua escola, foi educadora numa creche na Maré e aluna da primeira turma de pré-vestibular comunitário do complexo, aos 19 anos, em 1998. … Hoje, a menina com nome de deusa indígena tem 19 anos e é caloura de educação física na Uerj.}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.bbc.com/portuguese/brasil-43423055 |title=Mulher, negra, favelada, Marielle Franco foi de 'cria da Maré' a símbolo de novas lutas políticas no Rio |publisher=BBC |author=Júlia Dias Carneiro |date=16 March 2018 |accessdate=16 March 2018|language=pt|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408144640/http://www.bbc.com/portuguese/brasil-43423055|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Marielle nasceu e cresceu no Complexo da Maré, e saiu do curso de pré-vestibular comunitário para a graduação em ciências sociais na PUC-Rio, universidade particular onde ela e outra colega eram as únicas mulheres negras do departamento. … Aos 19 anos, se tornou mãe de uma menina, Luyara. }} Franco raised her daughter without the father's help and worked as a pre-school teacher making minimum wage.{{cite web|url=https://www.ozy.com/rising-stars/a-favela-born-political-up-and-comer-in-brazil/72122|title=A Favela-Born Political Up-and-Comer in Brazil|date=30 September 2016|author=Anna Jean Kaiser|publisher=Ozy|accessdate=2018-03-17|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180408145734/https://www.ozy.com/rising-stars/a-favela-born-political-up-and-comer-in-brazil/72122|archive-date=2018-04-08|dead-url=no|quote=Franco got pregnant at 18; her child’s father wasn’t around after the first few years. She took a job as a preschool teacher earning a minimum wage — about $200 a month — to support herself and her child.}} ==Education== In 2000, she began her [[Cursinho|pre-university studies]].{{cite web|url=https://medium.com/revista-subjetiva/entrevistamos-marielle-franco-mulher-negra-perif%C3%A9rica-e-vereadora-do-rj-mulheres-na-pol%C3%ADtica-7839b7fbfe06|title=Entrevistamos Marielle Franco: mulher, negra, periférica e Vereadora do RJ - Mulheres na Política #1|publisher=Redação Subjetiva|date=16 May 2017|accessdate=2018-03-17}} Following the death of a friend from a stray bullet in 2000, Franco began working in human rights activism. In 2002, she entered the [[Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro]] on a scholarship and continued working and raising her daughter as she earned a degree in social sciences. She went on to earn a master's degree in public administration from the [[Fluminense Federal University]].{{cite web|url=http://oglobo.globo.com/brasil/da-mare-marielle-franco-chega-camara-como-quinta-mais-votada-20228691|title=Da Maré, Marielle Franco chega à Câmara como a quinta mais votada|date=4 October 2016|accessdate=15 March 2017|publisher=O Globo|language=pt}} She wrote her master's thesis (titled "[[Pacifying Police Unit|UPP]]: The Reduction of the Favela to Three Letters") on the law enforcement program to retake control of the city's favelas from gangs. ==Political career== [[File:Marielle_Franco_em_agosto_de_2016.jpg|thumb|right|Marielle Franco in August 2016]] Beginning in 2007, Franco worked for state representative [[Marcelo Freixo]] as a consultant, and she coordinated the state legislature's Committee for the Defense of Human Rights and Citizenship.{{cite web|url=http://www.anf.org.br/entrevista-marielle-franco/|title=Entrevista: Marielle Franco|author=Julianne Gouvela|date=23 November 2016|language=pt|publisher=Agência de Notícias das Favelas|accessdate=2018-03-20}}{{cite web|url=https://broadly.vice.com/en_us/article/kzp4dv/marielle-franco-activist-against-brazils-police-brutality-assassinated-in-rio|title=Marielle Franco, Activist Against Brazil's Police Brutality, Assassinated in Rio|publisher=Vice|author=Marie Declercq translated by Meredith Balkus|date=15 March 2018|accessdate=2018-03-17}} She also worked for civil society organizations, including the Brazil Foundation and the Maré Center for Solidarity Studies and Action.{{cite web|url=http://www.rioonwatch.org/?p=32963|title=Favela Candidates Run for Office, Among ‘City Council Members We Want’ [VIDEO]|author=Nour El-Youssef|date=22 September 2016|accessdate=2018-03-20|publisher=Rio On Watch|archive-url=https://archive.is/AlVhs|archive-date=2018-05-01|quote=She has worked for various civil society organizations, including the Brazil Foundation and CEASM (Maré Center for Solidarity Studies and Action). Currently, she is the coordinator of the Commission for the Defense of Human Rights and Citizenship in the Rio de Janeiro State Legislative Assembly (Alerj).}} In 2016, Franco ran for a seat on the Rio de Janeiro city council in the [[Brazilian municipal elections, 2016|municipal elections]]. As a black woman and single mother from the favelas, Franco positioned herself as a representative and defender of poor black women and people from the favelas.{{cite web|url=http://www.vozdascomunidades.com.br/destaques/mae-preta-favelada-e-vereadora-marielle-franco/|title=Mãe, preta, favelada e vereadora: Marielle Franco|publisher=Voz das Comunidades|date=26 June 2017|author=Maria Morganti Pinheiro|accessdate=2018-03-20|language=pt}} With over 46,500 votes, Franco was one of 51 people elected, receiving the fifth highest vote total out of more than 1,500 candidates.{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-violence/thousands-march-in-brazil-after-murder-of-activist-councilwoman-idUSKCN1GR2BA?il=0|title=Thousands march in Brazil after murder of activist councilwoman|date=15 March 2018|work=Reuters|access-date=2018-03-15|author=Brad Brooks}}{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/marielle-franco-death-dead-dies-brazil-assassination-rio-de-janeiro-protest-glenn-greenwald-a8259516.html|author=[[Glenn Greenwald]]|date=16 March 2018|title=Marielle Franco: Why my friend was a repository of hope and a voice for Brazil's voiceless, before her devastating assassination|accessdate=2018-03-17|publisher=The Independent}} As a city council member, Franco fought against gender violence, for reproductive rights, and for the rights of favela residents. She chaired the Women's Defense Commission and formed part of a four-person committee that monitored the federal intervention in Rio de Janeiro.{{Cite web |url=https://g1.globo.com/rj/rio-de-janeiro/noticia/negra-da-mare-e-sociologa-marielle-foi-a-5-vereadora-mais-votada-do-rio.ghtml/ |title=Negra da Maré e socióloga, Marielle foi a 5ª vereadora mais votada do Rio |publisher=G1 |date=15 March 2018 |accessdate=2018-03-16|language=pt}}{{Cite web |url=https://brasil.elpais.com/brasil/2018/03/16/politica/1521157108_642756.html |title=Assassinato político de Marielle Franco reativa as ruas e desafia intervenção no Rio |publisher=El País |author=Felipe Betim |date=16 March 2018 |accessdate=2018-03-16}} Working with the Rio de Janeiro Lesbian Front, Franco presented a bill to create a day of lesbian visibility in Rio de Janeiro in August 2017, but the bill was defeated by a vote of 19-17.{{cite web|url=https://www.brasildefato.com.br/2017/08/18/camara-do-rio-de-janeiro-rejeita-projeto-pela-visibilidade-lesbica/|title=Câmara do Rio de Janeiro rejeita projeto pela visibilidade lésbica|author=Camila Marins|publisher=Brasil de Fato|date=18 August 2017|accessdate=2018-03-16}} ==Final days and assassination== [[File:Marielle Vitória.png|thumb|right|Demonstration held in [[Greater Vitória|Vitória]] to honor the memory of Marielle Franco and Anderson Pedro Gomes.]] On 13 March 2018, Franco spoke out on [[Twitter]] against the police violence in Rio de Janeiro: “Another homicide of a young man that could be credited to the police. Matheus Melo was leaving church when he was killed. How many others will have to die for this war to end?” ({{lang-pt|Mais um homicídio de um jovem que pode estar entrando para a conta da PM. Matheus Melo estava saindo da igreja. Quantos mais vão precisar morrer para que essa guerra acabe?}}) The next day, Franco attended a round-table discussion titled "Black Youngsters Moving [Power] Structures" ({{lang-pt|Jovens Negras Movendo Estruturas}}).{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/portuguese/brasil-43424088|title=Marielle era uma das 32 mulheres negras entre 811 vereadores eleitos em capitais brasileiras|last=Gragnani|first=Juliana|date=15 March 2018|website=BBC|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 March 2018}} Less than two hours after leaving the round-table, she and her driver, Anderson Pedro Gomes, were fatally shot by two men who were driving another car. The men fired nine shots at them, four of which struck Franco – three in the head and one in the neck.{{cite web|url=http://brasil.estadao.com.br/noticias/rio-de-janeiro,direcao-dos-tiros-contra-marielle-reforca-hipotese-de-ataque-premeditado,70002229183|title=Direção dos tiros contra Marielle reforça hipótese de ataque premeditado|author=Roberta Jansen, Marcio Dolzan e Fabio Grellet|date=15 March 2018|website=Estadão|accessdate=2018-03-18}} Franco's press officer was next to her in the back seat and survived with injuries.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/15/marielle-franco-shot-dead-targeted-killing-rio|title=Marielle Franco, councillor and police critic, shot dead in targeted killing in Rio|last=Associated Press|date=2018-03-15|website=The Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-03-15}} Marcelo Freixo, a Rio de Janeiro legislative assembly member from [[Socialism and Liberty Party|PSOL]] who came to the scene shortly after hearing of her killing, determined that the bullets had been directed at her in a clear execution. According to the Rio de Janeiro police, the direction of the nine shots supports the hypothesis that Franco was assassinated. The bullets that killed Franco are from a batch bought by the [[Federal Police of Brazil|federal police]] in [[Brasília]] in 2006;{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/18/marielle-franco-brazil-favelas-mourn-death-champion|title=Marielle Franco: Brazil’s favelas mourn the death of a champion|last=Phillips|first=Dom|date=17 March 2018|website=The Guardian|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 March 2018}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.mintpressnews.com/suspicious-murder-of-anti-police-brutality-activist-sparks-large-protests-in-brazil/239023/|title=Suspicious Murder of Anti-Police Brutality Activist Sparks Large Protests In Brazil|last=Canofre|first=Fernanda|date=16 March 2018|website=Mint Press News|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 March 2018}} Minister of Public Security [[Raul Jungmann]] later said that they were stolen from a post office storage facility in [[Paraíba]],{{cite web|url=http://riotimesonline.com/brazil-news/rio-politics/ammunition-which-killed-rio-lawmaker-stolen-from-police/|title=Ammunition Which Killed Marielle Franco in Rio Stolen from Police|author=Lise Alves|date=17 March 2018|publisher=The Rio Times|accessdate=2018-03-23}} but the ministry subsequently retracted this explanation after the Post Office publicly denied it.{{cite web | last=Adorno | first=s | title=Ministério muda versão de Jungmann sobre roubo de munição usada em assassinato de Marielle | website=Cotidiano | date=Mar 19, 2018 | url=https://noticias.uol.com.br/cotidiano/ultimas-noticias/2018/03/19/jungmann-recua-sobre-roubo-de-municao-usada-em-assassinato-de-marielle.htm | language=pt | access-date=Mar 21, 2018}} === Reactions to assassination === Thousands took to the streets in coordinated protests across Brazil, and both [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] condemned her killing.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/mar/15/marielle-franco-shot-dead-targeted-killing-rio|title=Protests held across Brazil after Rio councillor shot dead|last=Phillips|first=Dom|date=2018-03-15|website=The Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-03-15|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6z5V4QCGK|archive-date=2018-05-01|dead-url=no|quote=One of Franco’s final posts on Twitter called attention to police violence. “Another homicide of a young man that could be credited to the police. Matheus Melo was leaving church when he was killed. How many others will have to die for this war to end?” she wrote.}}{{Cite news|url=http://justificando.cartacapital.com.br/2018/03/15/atos-de-protesto-por-marielle-franco-estao-marcados-em-mais-de-10-capitais/|title=Atos de protesto por Marielle Franco estão marcados em mais de 10 capitais|date=2018-03-15|work=Justificando|access-date=2018-03-15|language=pt-BR}} Journalist [[Glenn Greenwald]], whose husband [[David Miranda (politician)|David Miranda]] was a fellow City Council member and close personal friend of Franco's,{{cite web | title=Big rallies after Rio politician shot dead, Newshour | website=BBC | date=1970-01-01 | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p061chqq | access-date=2018-07-28}}{{cite web | last=Bernstein | first=Fred A. | title=The Unflinching Courage of Rio’s Gay Crusader | website=Out Magazine | date=2018-05-11 | url=https://www.out.com/news-opinion/2018/5/11/undaunting-courage-rios-gay-crusader | access-date=2018-07-28}} listed what he referred to as the "most important subjects to cover" regarding Franco's assassination stating:
Her relentless and brave activism against the most lawless police battalions, her opposition to military intervention, and, most threateningly of all, her growing power as a black, gay woman from the favela seeking not to join Brazil’s power structure, but to subvert it.
== Legacy == A digital art workshop was held in [[Nairobi]], Kenya titled "Portraits of Marielle: Creating Bridges between Kenya and Brazil" with young Kenyan artists participating, and the artworks were displayed at the Museum Mare in Rio de Janeiro on 10 November 2018.{{cite web|title= Building Bridges Between Favelas in Kenya and Brazil Through 'Artivism' |language= en |url= http://www.rioonwatch.org/?p=49106 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20181123004432/http://www.rioonwatch.org/?p=49106 | archivedate= 2018-11-23 |first= Chloe |last= Villalobos |publisher= RioOnWatch|accessdate= 2018-12-01 |date= 2018-11-22 |ref= harv }} Amnesty International included Franco's name in its campaign for those who wrote for human rights and lost their lives,{{cite web|title= Amnesty International launches world’s biggest human rights campaign |language= en |url= https://www.amnestyusa.org/press-releases/amnesty-international-launches-worlds-biggest-human-rights-campaign/ |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20181129040352/https://www.amnestyusa.org/press-releases/amnesty-international-launches-worlds-biggest-human-rights-campaign/ |publisher= Amnesty International |archivedate= 2018-11-29 |accessdate= 2018-12-01 |date= 2018-11-29 }} while an update was made and an online tribute listed Franco among over 400 human rights advocates for women by the [[Association for Women's Rights in Development]].{{cite news|title= Women's rights take centre stage as murdered activists are remembered |url= https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2018/nov/29/womens-rights-take-centre-stage-murdered-activists-remembered-international-women-human-rights-defenders-day |language= en |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20181201074418/https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2018/nov/29/womens-rights-take-centre-stage-murdered-activists-remembered-international-women-human-rights-defenders-day |publisher= the Guardian |first= Liz |last= Ford |archivedate= 2018-12-01 |accessdate= 2018-12-01 |date= 2018-11-29}} ==Personal life== Franco identified as bisexual.{{cite web|url= https://g1.globo.com/rj/rio-de-janeiro/noticia/os-ultimos-momentos-de-marielle-franco-antes-de-ser-morta-com-quatro-tiros-na-cabeca.ghtml|title= Os últimos momentos de Marielle Franco antes de ser morta com quatro tiros na cabeça|website= globo.com|author= Lígia Mesquita|date= 15 March 2018 |access-date= 29 May 2018}}{{cite web|url= http://www.bbc.com/portuguese/brasil-43558653|title= Rejeição da família, pedido de casamento e luto: a história de amor interrompida de Marielle e Monica|language= pt |website= bbc.com|first= Júlia |last= Dias Carneiro |location= Rio de Janeiro |date= 30 March 2018 |publisher= BBC|access-date= 29 May 2018}} In 2017, she moved to the Rio de Janeiro neighbourhood of [[Tijuca]] with her partner, Mônica Tereza Benício, and her 18-year-old daughter, Luyara Santos.{{cite web|url=https://odia.ig.com.br/rio-de-janeiro/2018/03/5522608-marielle--cria-do-parque-esperanca.html#foto=1|title= Marielle, 'cria' do Parque Esperança|publisher= O Dia|date=16 March 2018|accessdate=2018-03-17|language=pt}}{{cite web|title=Just as U.S. Media Does With MLK, Brazil’s Media Is Trying to Whitewash and Exploit Marielle Franco’s Political Radicalism|url=https://theintercept.com/2018/03/19/just-as-u-s-media-does-with-mlk-brazils-media-now-trying-to-whitewash-and-exploit-marielle-francos-political-radicalism/|author=Glenn Greenwald|publisher=[[The Intercept]]|date=19 March 2018|accessdate=2018-03-19}} Marielle and Mônica had met at a trip with friends when they were 18 and 24 years old, respectively. They had been dating for 13 years, although the relationship had often been interrupted due to the non-acceptance of their families and friends. In these times, Mônica had relationships with other women and men and Marielle with other men. Franco and Benício had been planning to marry in September 2019.{{cite web|url=http://brasil.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,viuva-de-marielle-conta-que-vereadora-estava-despreocupada-dias-antes-do-assassinato,70002232935|title=Viúva de Marielle conta que vereadora estava despreocupada dias antes do assassinato|date=18 March 2018|accessdate=2018-03-23|publisher=O Estado de S. Paulo |language=pt}} ==See also== * [[List of assassinations#Brazil|List of assassinations § Brazil]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web | url = https://twitter.com/mariellefranco/status/973568966403731456 | title = Marielle Franco @mariellefranco | last = Franco | first = Marielle | publisher = [[Twitter]] | date = 2018-03-13 | language= Portuguese | accessdate = 2018-05-01 | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/6z5W2bljV | archivedate = 2018-05-01 | quote = Mais um homicídio de um jovem que pode estar entrando para a conta da PM. Matheus Melo estava saindo da igreja. Quantos mais vão precisar morrer para que essa guerra acabe? }} }} ==External links== *{{Commons category-inline}} {{Authority control}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Franco, Marielle}} [[Category:1979 births]] [[Category:2018 deaths]] [[Category:Activists from Rio de Janeiro (city)]] [[Category:Afro-Brazilian people]] [[Category:Brazilian politicians of African descent]] [[Category:Assassinated Brazilian politicians]] [[Category:Brazilian feminists]] [[Category:Brazilian women in politics]] [[Category:LGBT politicians from Brazil]] [[Category:LGBT African Brazilians]] [[Category:African-Brazilian feminists]] [[Category:Municipal Chamber of Rio de Janeiro councillors]] [[Category:Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro alumni]] [[Category:Socialism and Liberty Party politicians]] [[Category:Brazilian sociologists]] [[Category:Brazilian socialists]] [[Category:Lesbian politicians]] [[Category:Lesbian feminists]] [[Category:Women whistleblowers]] [[Category:Police brutality in Brazil]] [[Category:Women critics]] [[Category:Brazilian critics]] [[Category:Cultural critics]] [[Category:Anti-poverty advocates]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Brazil]]

{{notability|1=Biographies|date=March 2018}}
'''Megan Callaway''' is a founder of [[The Archer School for Girls]] <ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.archer.org/page/about/history-and-mission|title=History and Mission {{!}} The Archer School for Girls|website=www.archer.org|language=en|access-date=2018-03-25}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1995-06-11/news/we-12082_1_pacific-palisades|title=PACIFIC PALISADES : Where Girls Can Be In a Class by Themselves|last=FELDMAN|first=LINDA|date=1995-06-11|work=Los Angeles Times|access-date=2018-03-25|language=en-US|issn=0458-3035}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|title=Learning Like a Girl: Educating Our Daughters in Schools of Their Own|last=Meehan|first=Diana|publisher=PublicAffairs Hachette Book Group|date=22 March 2007|isbn=|location=New York|pages=25}}</ref> and has been an advocate and fundraiser for education, especially for under represented populations and single sex education for a quarter century.<ref name=":2" /> She is an award-winning filmmaker of documentaries and dramas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.directcinema.com/category/14|title=DirectCinemaLtd: ALA Award Winners|last=|first=|date=2014|website=directcinema|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=27 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|title=Perfect Harmony: The Whiffenpoofs in China|url=http://www.directcinema.com/category/14/84|accessdate=2018-03-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://archive.org/details/ERIC_ED366309|title=ERIC ED366309: Media Log: A Guide to Film, Television, and Radio Programs Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities, Division of Public Programs, Humanities Projects in Media. Page 78|last=Education Resources Information Center|first=(ERIC)|date=1992|website=archive.org|archive-url=https://archive.org/details/ericarchive|archive-date=1992|dead-url=|access-date=27 March 2018}}</ref>
== Life == She graduated from [[Vassar College]], and received a master’s degree in Film from [[Yale School of Art|Yale University School of Art]] where she worked under Michael Roemer.
== Work == In 1995 she co-founded [[The Archer School for Girls]], based on research about how girls learn, develop, thrive and become leaders in the 21st century.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> Currently she is Associate Vice President for Advancement at [[Scripps College]].<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.scrippscollege.edu/offices/officesservices/advancement|title=Directory {{!}} Office of Institutional Advancement|website=www.scrippscollege.edu|language=en|access-date=2018-03-25}}</ref>
== Filmmography (selected) == 2008: WWII Behind Closed Doors: Stalin, the Nazis, and the West - Producer US version, BBC/KCET<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pbs.org/auschwitz/about/producers.html|title=Auschwitz: Inside the Nazi State . About . Producers {{!}} PBS|website=www.pbs.org|access-date=2018-03-25}}</ref>
2005 Auschwitz: Inside the Nazi State, award winning six-part docudrama series, for BBC KCET/PBS, Producer PBS version<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2005/scene/markets-festivals/auschwitz-inside-the-nazi-state-1200528633/|title=Auschwitz: Inside the Nazi State|last=Lowry|first=Brian|date=2005-01-18|work=Variety|access-date=2018-03-25|language=en-US}}</ref>
2002 Copenhagen, adaptation of [[Michael Frayn|Michael Frayn’s]] play, starring [[Daniel Craig]], [[Stephen Rea|Steven Rea]], [[Francesca Annis]] for BBC, KCET/PBS, producer PBS version, writer/producer Prologue/Epilogue <ref>{{Cite journal|date=2017-08-26|title=Copenhagen (2002 film)|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Copenhagen_(2002_film)&oldid=797290782|journal=Wikipedia|language=en}}</ref>
1996 Talk to Me, made for television movie, Co-Producer, ABC
1996 [[She Cried No]], made for television movie exploring date rape, Producer, NBC<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/1996/film/reviews/she-cried-no-1200446682/|title=She Cried No|last=Everett|first=Todd|date=1996-09-23|work=Variety|access-date=2018-03-26|language=en-US}}</ref>
1996 [[Unabomber: The True Story]] Co-Executive Producer, USA Network<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/entertainment/fast-work-put-unabomber-screen-article-1.743728|title=FAST WORK PUT 'UNABOMBER' ON SCREEN|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2018-03-26|language=en}}</ref>
1995 The Sister-in-Law, made for television movie, writer, USA Network
1986 American Masters-''Eugene O'Neill: A Glory of Ghosts'', Producer, PBS<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1986/09/08/arts/tv-reviews-eugene-o-neill-channel-13-profile.html|title=TV REVIEWS; 'EUGENE O'NEILL,' CHANNEL 13 PROFILE|last=O'Connor|first=John J.|access-date=2018-03-25|language=en}}</ref>
1985 Perfect Harmony: The Whiffenpoofs in China, producer/director, Disney Channel<ref>{{Citation|title=Perfect Harmony: The Whiffenpoofs in China|url=http://www.directcinema.com/category/150/84|accessdate=2018-03-25}}</ref>
== References ==
